summary: The focus in directed molecular evolution is shifting towards library quality and comprehensive analysis methods, with new techniques improving diversity generation and screening efficiency.
key_claims: Research is increasingly focusing on the quality and comprehensiveness of libraries constructed through directed molecular evolution.
New methods for generating diverse molecular libraries are being developed to reduce bias and increase efficiency.

_title: Novel methods for directed evolution of enzymes: quality, not quantity
_abstract: In the past decade methods of directed molecular evolution have proven revolutionary in protein engineering. An increasing number of powerful new combinatorial techniques have joined rational design methods as effective tools for the manipulation and tailoring of biocatalysts. More and more, research in this maturing field is focusing on the quality and comprehensiveness of library construction and analysis. Additionally, in-depth studies have begun to highlight the underlying evolutionary mechanisms, limitations, and consequences of the various methodologies. Together, these investigations are creating a framework for future engineering projects.
